overview: Hanson is vice president, operations at Wisconsin-based Baylake Bank. During his 30-year career at the bank, he has held various positions including internal auditor and chief investment officer. In 1991, Hanson was instrumental in the creation of a new data processing company called United Financial Services (UFS), jointly owned by Baylake Bank, First National Bank in Manitowoc, and State Bank of Kewaunee (which was later acquired by Baylake Bank). UFS, headquartered in Grafton, Wisc., currently does data processing for 40 banks throughout the state, ranging in size from $33 million to $1 billion in assets. Hanson holds a Bachelorâ€™s in business administration and finance from the University of Wisconsin-Whitewater and graduated from the University of Wisconsin-Madison, Graduate School of Banking
